I updated the graphs in my phased search write-up to reflect the changes 
in SharpNEAT, following the discussions about the slightly odd looking 
graph with falling fitness. SharpNEAT now always keeps at least one 
'best' species so that the best fitness for a population will never be 
seen to drop. It seems to work quite well, in fact using this in 
combination with a higher connection addition mutation rate I was able 
to evolve a network that solves the simple OCR problem perfectly, 26 out 
of 26 characters correct.

Anyway, the new graphs tell pretty much the same story but are less 
confusing, so I thought it would be a good idea to update them.

Colin.
